item.title: Reproducible ICD Conversion With ATHENA and R
item.description: Why Bother? If you work with diagnosis data, youâ€™re likely to encounter ICD codes. ICD (Internal Classification of Diseases) is a globally used set codes that hierarchically classifies diagnoses, symptoms, and other clinical observations. Since the adoption of the Electronic Health Records (EHR), the primary revision of ICD in use ICD-9. At least, that was so until October 1st, 2015, when the United States made a nationwide switch to ICD-10.
